answerText: polarization [or word forms][10] The negative divergence of the polarization vector is equal to the density of this kind of charge. The density of this kind of charge can be found by subtracting the free charge from the total charge.

subject: Science
question: Question: The Maxwell-Wagner-Sillars version of this quantity arises due to charge buildup on interfaces. For 10 points each: [10] Name this property of a bulk material, the separation of positive and negative charges. This term also refers to the direction of the electric field of propagating light wave, which can take linear, circular, or elliptical orientations.
